body.section:
Often one wishes to search for concepts similar in meaning or similar in name to a given concept. The Workbench IDE can assist in finding terms that are similar lexically, by constructing a lucene search based on the components of the currently displayed description in the taxonomy view.
By right clicking a term in the taxonomy view, a pop-up appears allowing the user to select 'Search for similar concepts ...', as shown in .Find Similar concept pop-up dialog

Selecting this option pre-populates the lucene search criteria field (or fields) with appropriate search expressions. The user may modify these, if desired, prior to executing the search. An example of applying this to the term Refraction of the Eye can be seen in . Here, the source relationships Is a Function of eye region structure, and Is a Visual function, are used as additional constraints on the primary search query "+(function) +(observable +disorder, +entity) +error, +eye +eye, +function +nos +ocular +of +refraction +refraction, +refractive", which itself is built up from the descriptions available for this concept. The exact algorithm used for constructing these "Search for similar concepts..." expressions may vary over time with feedback from users.Example: find concepts similar to "Refraction of Eye".
